noun.description: A medical condition in which the lens of the eye becomes progressively opaque, resulting in blurred vision.
examples: she had cataracts in both eyes

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin cataracta waterfall, floodgate, also portcullis (medical cataract (sense 2) probably being a figurative use of this), from Greek kataraktēs down-rushing, from katarassein, from kata- down + arassein strike, smash.
